topic: Journaling as a Morning or Evening Ritual

dialog.text: If journaling helps, why should I start—morning or night, with a busy life?
dialog.instructions: calm, curious; soft morning-light vibe; gentle pacing.

dialog.text: Both work. The ritual is not about the hour; it's about showing up for yourself, even when you're tired.
dialog.instructions: warm, confident; mid tempo; deliberate emphasis on the idea of the ritual.

dialog.text: I snooze my alarm—will a morning ritual even stick?
dialog.instructions: slightly hesitant; slower; emphasize doubt gently.

dialog.text: Make it tiny: two minutes, two simple questions.
What should I write in two minutes?
dialog.instructions: curious; concise; quick tempo; direct question.

dialog.text: What am I grateful for? What would make today meaningful?
I can do that—two tiny lines, done.
Or, if evenings suit you, reflect on what happened and what to carry forward.
If you're watching, pick morning or evening, try this tiny ritual for a week, and share what you learned in the comments.
dialog.instructions: inviting; direct call to action; bright ending.
